comments.name: Rhinostone
comments.comment: Excellent post! Thank you. process.nexTick() is useless, you are only going to differ the execution. But, there is a way: by "spawning" your task, you can run your "Fibonacci" code in another thread (child_process). Just, don't forget to kill the thread. Limitation: can be expensive with memory usage if you are doing that a lot.
